titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Or 2505: Perushim

availability.licence: These images and the content of British Library Or 2505: Perushim are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, British Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about British Library Or 2505: Perushim. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Five fragments of Japhet ben Ali's Judeo-Arabic commentaries on various biblical books.

supportDesc.extent: Part I: Folios 1-30 Part II: Folios 31-80. Part III: Folios 81-87. Part IV: Folios 88-97. Part V: Folios 98 and 99.;

layoutDesc.layout: Part I: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 16; written lines: 16; The pointed biblical text is embodied, followed by an Arabic translation. Catchwords on every verso. Part II: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 16; written lines: 16; The Hebrew biblical text is embodied. Part III: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 16; written lines: 16; Uniform layout. Part IV: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 16; written lines: 16; The pointed Hebrew text is embodied. Catchwords on every verso. Part V: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 16; written lines: 16; The pointed Hebrew text is embodied. Catchwords on every verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Part I: Semi-cursive script of the 16th century.Part II: Square and semi-cursive scripts of the 15th century.Part III: Square and semi-cursive scripts of the 15th century.Part IV: Square and semi-cursive scripts of approximately the 16th century.Part V: Square and semi-cursive scripts of appoximately the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Yefet. Com. on Prophets. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2505.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882, folio [100v].
